channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump orders Secretary of State to lobby the Olympics to ban transgender athletes—even though only 1 openly transgender athlete has ever competed in a women’s category
item.description: Los Angeles will be the host city for the 2028 Olympics, which will take place during Trump’s second administration.

item.title: Vance, in First Foreign Speech, Tells Europe That U.S. Will Dominate A.I.
item.description: Speaking in Paris at an artificial intelligence summit, the vice president gave an America First vision of the technology — with the U.S. dominating t...

item.title: Bannon Pleads Guilty to Fraud in Border Wall Case but Will Serve No Time
item.description: President Trump had already pardoned his adviser in a similar federal case, which accused him of skimming money from donations to build a southern bor...

item.title: Europe’s revenge on U.S. tariffs will hit America where it hurts most, targeting treasured exports like bourbon, jeans, and motorcycles
item.description: U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum “will not go unanswered,” European Union chief Ursula von der Leyen said.

item.title: Luis Rubiales, Spain’s Former Top Soccer Official, Testifies About Kissing Star Player
item.description: Luis Rubiales said at his sexual assault trial that he had asked permission to kiss the star player Jennifer Hermoso after the country’s national team...

item.title: More Than 175 World War II Practice Bombs Found at Playground in England
item.description: Although the devices found during construction work were practice bombs, they can be harmful. Officials said there could be more.

item.title: Nonstop Earthquakes Leave Santorini Empty and Its Residents on Edge
item.description: Thousands of tremors, sometimes every few minutes, have shaken Santorini, Greece. More than 13,000 of its 15,500 inhabitants have left.

item.title: The C-suite anxiety index: Here’s who’s worried about losing their job
item.description: Anxiety levels in the corporate world are actually lower this year than they were last year.

item.title: Tesla design chief drops bombshell leak: the CyberCab will spearhead robotaxi pilot in Texas
item.description: The revolutionary two seater will be used in the Austin robotaxi program starting in June, suggesting Tesla could be much closer to series production ...

item.title: U.N. Suspends Humanitarian Work in Yemeni Area Over Houthi Hold More Staff
item.description: The total employees arrested since 2021 has risen to 24, a U.N. spokesman said. The Iran-backed Houthis have held them on murky charges of espionage a...

item.title: How Trump is Using Language to Target Transgender Rights
item.description: President Trump has signed five executive orders targeting transgender rights since coming to office. What’s striking about these executive orders isn...

item.title: Ozempic, Wegovy maker calls out Hims & Hers Super Bowl ad: ‘Check before you inject’
item.description: Compounded weight-loss medications such as those promoted in the Hims & Hers commercial aren’t approved by the Food and Drug Administration.

item.title: As Trump Attacks D.E.I., Wall Street Worries
item.description: Goldman Sachs will drop a demand that corporate boards of directors include women and members of minority groups as financial firms backpedal from D.E...

item.title: Strong Storm Expected to Soak Southern California, Raising Fears of Mudslides
item.description: It could be the biggest storm the area has seen so far this winter.

item.title: Steel and Aluminum Tariffs May Raise US Manufacturing Costs
item.description: Duties of 25 percent on steel and aluminum will flow through to car buyers, beer drinkers, home builders, oil drillers and other users of metal goods.
